trans-unit.source: Bluetooth: The Bluetooth status LED indicates when the Bluetooth wireless transceiver is enabled. Bluetooth is a wireless industry standard that enables portable devices to communicate over short distances.

Battery status: The battery status LED indicates the condition of the computer battery. A laptop computer can use a battery or an AC power adapter to operate. The type of battery and how the laptop is used affects how long a battery charge will last.

Network LEDs: The two network LEDs are lights that inidcate the status of the network connection. The green link light indicates network connectivity. The other LED light indicates the traffic to and from the laptop.
Parallel port: The parallel port is a socket that is used to connect a device such as a printer or scanner.
AC power connector: The AC power connector is a connector that is used to attach the AC power adapter to the laptop and to charge the battery.
Battery bay: The battery bay is a connector that is used to attach a laptop battery.
Security keyhole: The security keyhole is a hard point in the laptop frame that is used to attach a security cable.
USB ports: The Universal Serial Bus (USB) port is a socket that is used to connect one or more perhipherals.
S-video port: The S-video port is a four-pin mini-DIN connector that is used to output video signals to a compatible device. S-video separates the brightness and color portions of a video signal.

Modem port: The RJ-11 modem port is a device that is used to connect the laptop to a standard telephone line. The modem can be used to connect the computer to the Internet, to fax documents, and to answer incoming calls.
Ethernet port: The ethernet port is an RJ-45 socket that is used to connect the laptop to a cabled local area network.

Network LEDs: The two network LEDs are lights that inidcate the status of the network connection. The green link light indicates network connectivity. The other LED light indicates the traffic to and from the laptop.
Headphone jack: The headphone jack is a socket that is used to output audio signals to connected stereo headphones or speakers.
Microphone jack: The microphone jack is a socket that is used to connect a microphone used for audio input.
Ventilation: The ventilation grill is a series of vents that allow hot air to be expelled from the interior of the laptop.
PC combo card slot: The PC combination card slot is an expansion slot that supports the PCExpress expansion cards in the top slot and PC Cards in the bottom slot.
Ventilation: The ventilation grill is a series of vents that allow hot air to be expelled from the interior of the laptop.
Battery latches: The battery latches are two security latches that are used to insert, remove, and secure the laptop battery.
Infrared port: The infrared port is a line-of-site wireless transceiver that is used for data transmission.
Laptop latch: The laptop latch is a lever that is used to open the laptop lid.
VGA port: The VGA port is a 15-pin socket that allows output to external displays and projectors.
Optical drive activity indicator: The optical drive activity indicator is an LED that is illuminated to indicate drive activity.
Optical drive: The optical drive is a disk drive that is used to read and write to CDs and DVDs.
Docking connector: The docking connector is a socket that is used to attach a docking station to the laptop.
Battery latches: The battery latches are two security latches that are used to insert, remove, and secure the laptop battery.
RAM access panel: The RAM access panel is a cover that provides access to the expansion memory.
Hard disk drive access panel: The hard drive access panel is a cover that provides access to the internal hard drive bay

Possible Solution
LCD laptop screen is not displaying anything
Disconnect any external monitors and use Fn key sequence to activate the LCD
Problem Symptom
Image on the LCD screen is too dim
Swap laptop to AC power and adjust brightness controls for the LCD
Image on the LCD screen contains a black border
Adjust display resolution setting
